doctor1.name: Dr. Shimizu
doctor1.title: Orthopedic Surgeon & Regenerative Medicine Specialist
doctor1.motto: The cutting-edge medical experience for your future self
doctor1.specialties: Orthopedics, Sports Medicine, Regenerative Medicine (Stem Cell & PRP Therapy)
doctor1.credentials: JOA-Certified Orthopedic Specialist | JOA Sports Medicine Certified | Certified Health Sports Physician
doctor1.bio: Board-certified orthopedic surgeon with over 35 years of frontline orthopedic practice. Specializes in advanced regenerative medicine including autologous adipose-derived stem cell therapy and PRP treatments. Focuses on fundamental improvement of chronic joint pain and motor function previously difficult with conventional treatments. Provides highly personalized, tailored medical care with maximum consideration for patient time and privacy.
doctor1.societies: Japanese Orthopaedic Association, Japanese Society for Regenerative Medicine, Japanese Society for Joint Disease

doctor2.name: Prof. Hiroshi Takayanagi
doctor2.title: Professor of Immunology, The University of Tokyo
doctor2.credentials: MD, PhD | Professor, Graduate School of Medicine, The University of Tokyo
doctor2.experience: 30+ years in research and clinical practice
doctor2.bio: Pioneering researcher who established the field of osteoimmunology - the study of bone-immune system interactions. Graduated from The University of Tokyo School of Medicine (1990), trained at Tokyo University Hospital and Tokyo Metropolitan Geriatric Hospital. Currently serves as Professor at The University of Tokyo since 2012. Holds multiple leadership positions including President of the Japanese Society for Bone and Mineral Research and Director of the Japanese Society of Osteoimmunology.
doctor2.awards: Japanese Society for Rheumatology Award (2004), Japan Medical Association Medical Award (2017), Uehara Prize (2019), Japan Academy Prize (2019)

doctor3.name: Shigeki Momohara
doctor3.nameJa: 桃原 茂樹 医師
doctor3.title: Chairman, Hakuei-kai Medical Corporation
doctor3.credentials: MD, PhD (Keio University) | JOA Specialist | Rheumatology Specialist & Supervisor
doctor3.bio: Graduated from Keio University School of Medicine and obtained PhD from the same institution. Conducted research at Rush University Medical Center (USA) and participated in Japan-Europe Rheumatoid Surgery Exchange Program. After serving as Assistant, Lecturer, Professor, and Vice Director at Tokyo Women's Medical University Rheumatology Center, became Special Appointed Professor at Keio University before assuming current position in 2025.
doctor3.expertise: Leading Japanese expert in orthopedics and rheumatology, highly regarded for treatment and research in osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, spinal disorders, osteoporosis, gout, and pseudogout. Actively engaged in medical education and international exchange leveraging extensive clinical and teaching experience.

doctor4.bio: Founder and Director of Rakan Clinic Tokyo Azabudai, leading evidence-based regenerative and aesthetic programs. Specialized in stem cell and exosome therapies delivered through compliant, patient-specific protocols. As a Visiting Researcher in Immunology at The University of Tokyo, combines cutting-edge research with clinical practice to provide innovative regenerative treatments.

faq.heading: Common Questions About Our Services
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our regenerative medicine treatments, international patient services, and clinic procedures.

items.question1: What types of regenerative medicine treatments do you offer?
items.answer1: We offer Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy and autologous adipose-derived stem cell therapy. These evidence-based treatments harness your body's natural healing capabilities to address joint pain, sports injuries, and chronic musculoskeletal conditions without surgery. All treatments are performed by JOA-certified orthopedic specialists and adhere to Japanese medical laws and ethical standards.
items.question2: How do I know if I'm a candidate for regenerative medicine?
items.answer2: Eligibility is determined on a case-by-case basis following a thorough medical evaluation by our physicians. We review your medical history, imaging studies, and current symptoms during a remote consultation. Common candidates include those with knee osteoarthritis, sports injuries, shoulder and hip pain, and spine conditions. We provide preliminary suitability screening before you travel to Tokyo.
items.question3: What is the cost of treatment and what does it include?
items.answer3: Our treatment packages range from $25,000~ for a single session to $200,000~ for an annual care program. Single sessions include consultation, treatment, and 1-month follow-up. Three-session packages include personalized treatment plans and 3-month follow-up. Annual programs include unlimited treatments and dedicated concierge service. All prices are estimates and final costs depend on individual treatment requirements.
items.question4: How long does the treatment process take?
items.answer4: The complete process typically takes 3-5 days in Tokyo. Day 1: Initial consultation and evaluation. Day 2: Treatment day (PRP or stem cell therapy). Days 3-5: Recovery and follow-up instructions. We provide detailed pre- and post-procedure instructions, and arrange telemedicine follow-ups once you return home. Travel planning support is included for international patients.
items.question5: Is regenerative medicine safe and what are the risks?
items.answer5: Yes, our treatments are very safe when performed by qualified specialists. All procedures are performed by JOA-certified orthopedic surgeons in our state-of-the-art facility. We use your own cells (autologous), eliminating rejection risks. Potential side effects are minimal and typically include mild discomfort, swelling, or bruising at the injection site. We provide comprehensive pre-treatment screening to ensure safety.
items.question6: Do you provide support for international patients?
items.answer6: Yes, we offer comprehensive international patient services including visa letters (if needed), hotel recommendations, airport transfers, and multilingual support. Our English-speaking coordinators ensure smooth communication throughout your stay. We provide travel planning assistance and can arrange accommodations in Tokyo's premium Azabudai Hills district, just 20 minutes from Haneda Airport.
items.question7: What makes Rakan Clinic different from other medical facilities?
items.answer7: We combine 35+ years of JOA-certified orthopedic expertise with cutting-edge regenerative medicine research. Our team includes University of Tokyo professors and leading researchers in osteoimmunology. We offer state-of-the-art in-house laboratory facilities, private consultation rooms for VIP patients, and a unique blend of Western orthopedics with Eastern medicine approaches. Our Azabudai Hills location provides premium, discreet care for elite clientele.
items.question8: How long does it take to see results from treatment?
items.answer8: Results vary by individual and condition, but many patients report initial improvements within 2-4 weeks. Full benefits typically develop over 3-6 months as the regenerative process continues. We provide detailed recovery timelines and regular follow-up care to monitor progress. Our telemedicine follow-up system ensures continued support after you return home, with progress tracking and adjustment recommendations as needed.

cta.title: Ready to Begin Your Treatment?
cta.description: Contact us for a personalized consultation and to discuss which treatment options are best for you.

facilities.heading: Cell Processing Center (CPC)
facilities.description: Our in-house CPC ensures maximum cell freshness, safety, and treatment effectiveness through pharmaceutical-grade sterile processing.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: To maximize the effectiveness of stem cell treatment, our clinic has established a Cell Processing Center (CPC) within our medical facility.
introduction.paragraph2: We are committed to delivering highly fresh and high-quality stem cells to patients in the best possible condition.

cpc.title: What is CPC?
cpc.description: CPC (Cell Processing Center: 細胞培養加工室) is a specialized facility for processing and culturing cells used in regenerative medicine and cell therapy, ensuring a sterile and clean environment.
features: Managed under strict standards equivalent to pharmaceutical manufacturing
High cleanliness due to cleanroom structure
24-hour quality control system by dedicated culture specialists

quality.title: Quality Appeal of Stem Cells
quality.description: Our self-fat-derived stem cells maintain a survival rate of over 95%. Under a microscope, they appear healthy, uniform, and spindle-shaped — a crucial sign of their good condition.
features: Maintaining a uniform and beautiful form
Retaining proliferative capacity and differentiation potential
Being delivered in a fresh state at the time of administration
Directly contributing to the stability and safety of clinical effects

equipment.title: Latest Equipment to Protect Stem Cells

safetyCabinet.title: Biological Safety Cabinet
safetyCabinet.description: A device for aseptic operations. It protects cells and specimens aseptically, while also protecting operators and the environment from biohazards. It ensures a thoroughly clean space with HEPA filters and UV sterilization.

co2Incubator.title: CO2 Incubator
co2Incubator.description: Constantly maintains the temperature, humidity, and CO2 concentration essential for stem cell culture. Enables stable proliferation of cells in an optimal environment.

microscope.title: Inverted Microscope
microscope.description: A microscope that allows observation of living cells directly in their culture vessels. It continuously confirms cell morphology and growth processes, always grasping their healthy state.

passBox.title: Pass Box
passBox.description: A system used for transferring items between clean rooms or sterile rooms and the outside environment. With an interlock function that prevents both doors from opening simultaneously, thereby maintaining constant cleanliness and airtightness.

centrifuge.title: Centrifuge
centrifuge.description: Essential for cell separation and processing. Ensures precise handling of cell samples with controlled centrifugal force for optimal cell quality and viability.

items.title: High Cell Survival Rate (95% or more)
items.description: Cultivation starts immediately after fat collection to minimize damage.

items.title: Long-term Preservation with Liquid Nitrogen (-196°C)
items.description: Preserved in a semi-permanently usable state, can be administered at the necessary timing.

items.title: Administered in a Highly Fresh State
items.description: After cultivation, it is quickly administered intravenously to maximize regenerative power.

items.title: Passage Limit (up to 4 times)
items.description: Prevents aging and risks due to excessive cell division, ensuring safety.

items.title: Culture Specialists Permanently Stationed at CPC
items.description: Experienced cultivation specialists constantly monitor and manage cells, protecting quality.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.paragraph1: We are thoroughly committed to the "quality" and "safety" of stem cell treatment. Our in-house CPC and state-of-the-art equipment, along with a management system by experienced cultivation specialists.
conclusion.paragraph2: All of these form the foundation for patients to receive treatment with peace of mind. We will continue to deliver the highest standard of stem cell treatment.

what-is-stem-cell-therapy.title: What is Stem Cell Therapy?
what-is-stem-cell-therapy.excerpt: Discover the fundamentals of stem cell therapy, how it works, and why it's revolutionizing regenerative medicine in Japan.
what-is-stem-cell-therapy.keywords: stem cell therapy, stem cell therapy Japan, Tokyo stem cell clinic, regenerative medicine, what are stem cells, cell therapy basics, Azabudai Hills medical, CPC certified Japan, autologous stem cells
what-is-stem-cell-therapy.quickAnswer: Stem cell therapy uses your body's own regenerative cells to repair damaged tissues. At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we specialize in autologous adipose-derived stem cell therapy processed in our certified CPC facility in Azabudai Hills.
content: Stem cell therapy represents one of the most promising frontiers in modern regenerative medicine. At its core, stem cell therapy involves using the body's own master cells to repair, regenerate, and restore damaged tissues and organs.

Stem cells are unique cells with two remarkable properties: they can divide and create more stem cells (self-renewal), and they can differentiate into specialized cell types such as muscle cells, nerve cells, or cartilage cells. This versatility makes them incredibly powerful tools for healing.

At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we specialize in autologous adipose-derived stem cell therapy. This means we harvest stem cells from your own fat tissue, process them in our state-of-the-art Cell Processing Center (CPC), and then reintroduce them to target areas where healing is needed.

The process begins with a minimally invasive fat collection procedure. A small amount of adipose tissue (fat) is extracted, typically from the abdomen or thigh area. This tissue is rich in mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs), which are particularly effective for orthopedic and regenerative applications.

These stem cells are then cultured and expanded in our in-house CPC under strict quality control protocols. The culture period typically lasts 6-8 weeks, during which the cells multiply while maintaining their regenerative potential.

Once the stem cells are ready, they are administered via intravenous infusion or direct injection into the affected area. The stem cells then work to reduce inflammation, promote tissue regeneration, and stimulate the body's natural healing processes.

Stem cell therapy has shown remarkable results in treating conditions such as osteoarthritis, sports injuries, chronic joint pain, and degenerative disc disease. Unlike traditional treatments that merely manage symptoms, stem cell therapy addresses the underlying cause by promoting actual tissue repair.
Why is Japan a Global Leader in Stem Cell Therapy?
Japan has established itself as a world leader in regenerative medicine through several key factors:

• Strict National Regulations: Japan's Act on Regenerative Medicine ensures rigorous oversight of stem cell processing and administration. All facilities must comply with PMDA (Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency) standards.

• Certified CPC Facilities: Cell Processing Centers (CPCs) in Japan, including our facility at Rakan Clinic Tokyo, operate under strict certification requirements ensuring high cell viability, sterility, and quality control.
• Academic Excellence: Strong partnerships with leading institutions like the University of Tokyo provide ongoing research validation and clinical expertise.
• Safe Autologous Protocols: Japan emphasizes autologous (self-derived) stem cell therapy, eliminating donor cell risks and rejection concerns.
• Advanced MSC Culture Technology: Japanese facilities utilize cutting-edge mesenchymal stem cell (MSC) culture techniques that maximize therapeutic potential while maintaining safety standards.
At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, located in the prestigious Azabudai Hills medical district, we combine these national advantages with our state-of-the-art CPC to deliver world-class regenerative medicine.

faq.question: Is stem cell therapy safe?
faq.answer: Autologous stem cell therapy (using your own cells) has a strong safety record with low complication risk. At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, all procedures are performed in our certified CPC facility following Japan's strict regenerative medicine regulations.

faq.question: What is a CPC (Cell Processing Center)?
faq.answer: A CPC is a certified facility where stem cells are processed, cultured, and prepared for treatment. Our CPC at Rakan Clinic Tokyo meets Japan's PMDA standards for sterility, quality control, and cell viability.

faq.question: How long does the stem cell culture process take?
faq.answer: The culture period typically lasts 6-8 weeks. During this time, your stem cells are expanded in our CPC under strict quality control protocols to ensure optimal therapeutic potential.

faq.question: Is stem cell therapy approved in Japan?
faq.answer: Yes. Japan has a comprehensive regulatory framework for regenerative medicine under the Act on Regenerative Medicine. All treatments at Rakan Clinic Tokyo comply with PMDA regulations and CPC certification requirements.

faq.question: How long does stem cell therapy last?
faq.answer: Many patients experience benefits for 12–36 months, especially when they follow recommended booster schedules and rehabilitation plans.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: Fat collection may cause mild soreness for a day or two. Infusions themselves are typically painless and performed in a comfortable lounge.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We usually begin with one session and personalise booster frequency—often every four months—based on your goals and progress.

does-stem-cell-therapy-work.title: Does Stem Cell Therapy Work?
does-stem-cell-therapy-work.excerpt: Explore the scientific evidence, success rates, and real-world outcomes of stem cell therapy for various conditions. Learn about safety, side effects, and success rates from Japan's leading regenerative medicine clinic.
does-stem-cell-therapy-work.keywords: stem cell therapy effectiveness, stem cell therapy success rate, does stem cell therapy work, is stem cell therapy safe, stem cell therapy side effects, regenerative medicine results, stem cell therapy before after, Tokyo stem cell clinic success rate
does-stem-cell-therapy-work.quickAnswer: Many patients experience meaningful reductions in pain and improved function. Best evidence exists for knee and hip osteoarthritis. Autologous stem cells have a strong safety profile. Results vary—not a guaranteed cure, but often effective for appropriate candidates.
content: This is perhaps the most frequently asked question about stem cell therapy, and the answer is nuanced but increasingly positive. The effectiveness of stem cell therapy depends on several factors: the condition being treated, the type of stem cells used, the patient's overall health, and the quality of the treatment protocol.

Scientific research has demonstrated that mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs), particularly those derived from adipose tissue, have significant therapeutic potential. These cells possess anti-inflammatory properties, can differentiate into various cell types, and secrete growth factors that promote healing.

For orthopedic conditions, numerous studies have shown promising results. Research published in peer-reviewed journals indicates that stem cell therapy can significantly reduce pain, improve joint function, and delay or potentially avoid the need for surgery in many patients with osteoarthritis and joint injuries.

At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we've observed positive outcomes in a significant percentage of our patients. Many report reduced pain within weeks of treatment, improved mobility, and enhanced quality of life. However, it's important to note that results can vary, and stem cell therapy is not a guaranteed cure for all conditions.

The success of stem cell therapy is also closely tied to the quality of the treatment. Our in-house Cell Processing Center ensures that stem cells are processed under optimal conditions, maintaining their viability and therapeutic potential. We follow strict protocols that meet or exceed international standards for cell processing.

It's crucial to understand that stem cell therapy works best when combined with appropriate rehabilitation and lifestyle modifications. The stem cells provide the foundation for healing, but the body needs proper support through physical therapy, exercise, and healthy habits to maximize results.

While stem cell therapy shows great promise, it's not appropriate for every condition or every patient. A thorough evaluation by our medical team helps determine whether stem cell therapy is a suitable option for your specific situation. We believe in evidence-based medicine and will only recommend treatments when we believe they offer genuine therapeutic potential.
Is Stem Cell Therapy Safe? Understanding Side Effects
Autologous stem cell therapy (using your own cells) has an excellent safety profile. Common considerations include:
• Minimal Side Effects: Most patients experience only mild discomfort at the injection site, typically resolving within 24-48 hours.
• No Rejection Risk: Since we use your own cells, there's no risk of immune rejection or allergic reactions.
• Low Infection Risk: Our certified CPC facility maintains strict sterile protocols, minimizing infection risk.
• Regulatory Oversight: All procedures at Rakan Clinic Tokyo comply with Japan's PMDA regulations, ensuring the highest safety standards.
Serious complications are rare when procedures are performed by qualified specialists in certified facilities. We conduct thorough pre-treatment evaluations to identify any contraindications.
Why is Japan a Global Leader in Stem Cell Therapy Research?
Japan's position as a leader in regenerative medicine stems from:
• PMDA Regulatory Framework: Japan's Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency provides comprehensive oversight of regenerative medicine, ensuring patient safety and treatment efficacy.
• University of Tokyo Research: Leading academic institutions conduct ongoing research validating stem cell therapy protocols and outcomes.
• CPC Certification Standards: Japan's strict CPC certification requirements ensure consistent quality across all processing facilities.
• Long-Term Clinical Data: Japanese clinics have accumulated extensive clinical data on stem cell therapy outcomes, contributing to evidence-based protocols.
At Rakan Clinic Tokyo in Azabudai Hills, we leverage these national advantages to provide evidence-based regenerative medicine.

faq.answer: Autologous stem cell therapy has a strong safety record with low complication risk. Using your own cells eliminates rejection concerns. Our certified CPC facility follows Japan's strict PMDA regulations ensuring the highest safety standards.

stem-cell-therapy-for-joint-pain.title: Stem Cell Therapy for Joint Pain
stem-cell-therapy-for-joint-pain.excerpt: Learn how stem cell therapy can effectively treat chronic joint pain, arthritis, and degenerative joint conditions at Tokyo's leading regenerative medicine clinic.
stem-cell-therapy-for-joint-pain.keywords: stem cell therapy for joint pain, arthritis treatment, knee pain stem cells, hip pain treatment, stem cell therapy Tokyo, joint pain treatment Japan, Azabudai Hills orthopedic
stem-cell-therapy-for-joint-pain.quickAnswer: Stem cell therapy effectively treats joint pain by reducing inflammation and promoting cartilage regeneration. Best results seen in knee and hip osteoarthritis. Many patients report significant pain reduction within 4-6 weeks. Treatment uses your own adipose-derived stem cells processed in our certified CPC.
content: Chronic joint pain affects millions of people worldwide, significantly impacting quality of life and daily activities. Traditional treatments often focus on symptom management through pain medications, physical therapy, or ultimately, joint replacement surgery. Stem cell therapy offers a regenerative alternative that addresses the root cause of joint pain.

Joint pain typically results from cartilage degeneration, inflammation, or damage to the joint structures. Over time, the body's natural healing capacity diminishes, leading to progressive deterioration. Stem cell therapy works by introducing healthy, regenerative cells directly into the affected joint, where they can promote healing and tissue regeneration.

The treatment process begins with a comprehensive evaluation to assess the extent of joint damage and determine the most appropriate treatment approach. Our specialists use advanced imaging techniques to visualize the joint condition and plan the optimal injection sites.

Stem cells are then harvested from your own adipose tissue and processed in our Cell Processing Center. Once ready, they are precisely injected into the affected joint under ultrasound or fluoroscopic guidance to ensure accurate placement.

Once in the joint, stem cells work through multiple mechanisms. They reduce inflammation by modulating the immune response, promote the growth of new cartilage cells, and stimulate the production of growth factors that support tissue repair. Many patients begin to notice improvements within 4-6 weeks, with continued progress over several months.

Stem cell therapy is particularly effective for conditions such as knee osteoarthritis, hip arthritis, shoulder pain, and ankle injuries. It can be used as a standalone treatment or in combination with other regenerative therapies like PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) for enhanced results.

One of the significant advantages of stem cell therapy for joint pain is that it's minimally invasive and uses your own cells, eliminating the risk of rejection or allergic reactions. The procedure is performed on an outpatient basis, and most patients can resume light activities within a few days.

While stem cell therapy can provide substantial relief, it's important to maintain realistic expectations. The goal is to reduce pain, improve function, and potentially delay or avoid surgery. Results vary based on the severity of the condition, age, and overall health of the patient.

faq.question: Is stem cell therapy effective for knee pain?
faq.answer: Yes, stem cell therapy has shown promising results for knee osteoarthritis and knee injuries. Many patients report significant pain reduction and improved mobility. Results are best for moderate to early-stage arthritis.

faq.question: How long does it take to see results from stem cell therapy for joint pain?
faq.answer: Many patients begin noticing improvements within 4-6 weeks, with continued progress over 3-6 months. Full benefits may take up to 6 months as tissue regeneration is a gradual process.

faq.question: Can stem cell therapy replace joint replacement surgery?
faq.answer: For some patients, stem cell therapy can delay or potentially avoid the need for joint replacement surgery. However, in cases of severe joint damage, surgery may still be necessary. Our medical team evaluates each case individually.

faq.question: Is stem cell therapy available for hip pain in Tokyo?
faq.answer: Yes, Rakan Clinic Tokyo in Azabudai Hills offers stem cell therapy for hip pain and hip arthritis. Our certified CPC facility processes autologous stem cells for hip joint injections.

faq.question: How long do results last?
faq.answer: Many patients experience reduced pain and better mobility for 12–24 months, especially when they complete prescribed rehabilitation programmes.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: The harvesting site can be tender briefly, and joint injections are completed under local anaesthesia to maximise comfort.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We generally start with a single session and reassess after 4–6 months. Booster infusions are scheduled according to imaging and functional goals.

stem-cell-therapy-vs-surgery.title: Stem Cell Therapy vs. Surgery: Which is Right for You?
stem-cell-therapy-vs-surgery.excerpt: Compare stem cell therapy with traditional surgical approaches to understand the benefits, risks, and recovery times of each option.
stem-cell-therapy-vs-surgery.keywords: stem cell therapy vs surgery, regenerative medicine alternative, non-surgical treatment, joint replacement alternative
content: When facing orthopedic conditions or joint problems, patients often find themselves choosing between traditional surgery and newer regenerative approaches like stem cell therapy. Understanding the differences, benefits, and limitations of each option is crucial for making an informed decision.

Traditional surgery, particularly joint replacement, has been the standard treatment for severe joint degeneration for decades. It's a well-established procedure with predictable outcomes, but it comes with significant drawbacks: invasive surgery, lengthy recovery periods, potential complications, and the fact that it's irreversible.

Stem cell therapy, on the other hand, offers a minimally invasive alternative that uses your body's natural healing mechanisms. The procedure involves harvesting your own stem cells, processing them, and reintroducing them to promote regeneration. It's outpatient-based, has minimal downtime, and preserves your natural joint structure.

One of the most significant advantages of stem cell therapy is the recovery time. While joint replacement surgery typically requires weeks of restricted activity, months of physical therapy, and up to a year for full recovery, stem cell therapy patients can often resume normal activities within days to weeks.

However, it's important to understand that stem cell therapy is not always a replacement for surgery. In cases of severe joint damage, advanced arthritis, or when conservative treatments have failed, surgery may still be the most appropriate option. The decision should be made in consultation with experienced medical professionals who can assess your specific condition.

At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we take a comprehensive approach. We evaluate each patient individually, considering factors such as age, activity level, severity of condition, and treatment goals. For many patients, we may recommend starting with regenerative therapies like stem cell therapy, reserving surgery as an option if needed.

Cost is another consideration. While stem cell therapy may seem expensive initially, it's important to factor in the costs of surgery, including hospital stays, rehabilitation, time off work, and potential complications. Stem cell therapy, being minimally invasive, typically involves lower overall costs when considering these factors.

The best approach is often a collaborative one. Our team works with patients to develop personalized treatment plans that may include stem cell therapy, physical therapy, lifestyle modifications, and, when necessary, surgical consultation. The goal is always to achieve the best possible outcome with the least invasive approach.

stem-cell-therapy-recovery-time.title: Stem Cell Therapy Recovery Time: What to Expect
stem-cell-therapy-recovery-time.excerpt: Understand the recovery process, timeline, and what you can expect after undergoing stem cell therapy treatment.
stem-cell-therapy-recovery-time.keywords: stem cell therapy recovery, recovery time, post-treatment care, stem cell therapy aftercare
content: One of the most appealing aspects of stem cell therapy is its relatively quick recovery time compared to traditional surgical procedures. However, understanding what to expect during the recovery period is essential for optimal outcomes.

The immediate post-procedure period is typically very manageable. Since stem cell therapy is minimally invasive, there's no surgical incision to heal. Most patients experience only mild discomfort at the injection site, which usually resolves within 24-48 hours. You can typically return home the same day and resume light activities almost immediately.

During the first week, it's important to avoid strenuous activities and heavy lifting. The treated area may be slightly swollen or tender, but this is normal and usually mild. You can continue with most daily activities, including work, as long as they don't involve excessive stress on the treated area.

The first month is a critical period for healing. During this time, the stem cells are actively working to reduce inflammation and begin the regeneration process. Many patients start to notice initial improvements during this period, though significant changes may take longer to manifest.

Between months 2-3, you'll typically see more noticeable improvements. Pain reduction becomes more apparent, and mobility often improves. This is when the regenerative effects of the stem cells become more evident. However, it's important to continue following your doctor's recommendations regarding activity levels and any prescribed physical therapy.

The full benefits of stem cell therapy may take 3-6 months to fully develop. This is because tissue regeneration is a gradual process. The stem cells need time to integrate, differentiate, and stimulate the body's natural healing mechanisms.

Throughout the recovery period, it's essential to support the healing process. This includes maintaining a healthy diet, staying hydrated, getting adequate rest, and following any prescribed physical therapy or exercise programs. Avoiding activities that could stress or damage the treated area is crucial during the early stages.

It's also important to have realistic expectations. While stem cell therapy can provide significant improvements, it's not an instant fix. The healing process is gradual, and results vary from person to person. Regular follow-up appointments with your medical team help monitor progress and adjust treatment plans as needed.

faq.question: How long do stem cell therapy results last?
faq.answer: Many patients sustain improvements for 12–36 months by combining boosters, physiotherapy, and healthy lifestyle habits.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: The harvesting site may be tender briefly. Infusions are typically painless and performed in a relaxed setting.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We begin with one session and plan boosters—often every four months—based on your recovery milestones and imaging.

stem-cell-therapy-cost.title: Understanding Stem Cell Therapy Cost
stem-cell-therapy-cost.excerpt: Learn about the factors that influence stem cell therapy pricing in Japan and what to consider when evaluating treatment costs at Tokyo's leading regenerative medicine clinic.
stem-cell-therapy-cost.keywords: stem cell therapy cost, stem cell therapy price, regenerative medicine cost, treatment pricing, stem cell therapy cost Japan, Tokyo stem cell therapy price, Azabudai Hills treatment cost
stem-cell-therapy-cost.quickAnswer: Stem cell therapy costs vary based on treatment complexity, CPC processing requirements, and facility standards. At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, costs include consultation, fat collection, CPC processing, injection, and follow-up care. Quality and safety standards in Japan's certified facilities justify the investment.
content: Understanding the cost of stem cell therapy is an important part of the decision-making process. The price can vary significantly based on several factors, and it's essential to understand what you're paying for and why costs differ between providers.

Several factors influence the cost of stem cell therapy. The type of stem cells used, the processing method, the facility's quality standards, and the complexity of your condition all play a role. At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we use autologous adipose-derived stem cells processed in our own state-of-the-art Cell Processing Center, which ensures the highest quality and safety standards.

The cost typically includes several components: the initial consultation and evaluation, the fat collection procedure, stem cell processing and culture in our CPC, the injection procedure, and follow-up care. When comparing costs, it's important to ensure you're comparing comprehensive treatment packages, not just individual procedure fees.

Quality and safety are paramount in stem cell therapy, and these come with associated costs. Our in-house Cell Processing Center operates under strict quality control protocols that meet or exceed international standards. This includes sterile processing environments, quality testing, and comprehensive documentation - all of which contribute to the overall cost but are essential for patient safety and treatment efficacy.

It's also important to consider the value proposition. While stem cell therapy may seem expensive initially, it's essential to compare it with the alternatives. Joint replacement surgery, for example, involves not just the surgical procedure but also hospital stays, anesthesia, physical therapy, and potential complications. When considering the total cost of care, recovery time, and quality of life improvements, stem cell therapy can be a cost-effective option.

At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we believe in transparent pricing. During your consultation, we'll provide a detailed breakdown of costs and explain what's included in your treatment package. We also offer different treatment plans to accommodate various needs and budgets.

It's worth noting that stem cell therapy is typically not covered by standard health insurance in most countries, as it's often considered an experimental or elective procedure. However, some patients may be able to use health savings accounts or flexible spending accounts for treatment costs. We're happy to discuss payment options and can provide documentation for insurance or tax purposes if needed.

When evaluating stem cell therapy costs, be cautious of providers offering significantly lower prices. Extremely low costs may indicate compromised quality, lack of proper processing facilities, or the use of less effective stem cell sources. Your health and safety should always be the priority, and choosing a reputable provider with proper facilities and protocols is essential.
Why Choose Japan for Stem Cell Therapy?
Japan offers several advantages for stem cell therapy that justify the investment:
• PMDA-Regulated Quality: All treatments comply with Japan's strict Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency regulations, ensuring the highest safety and efficacy standards.
• Certified CPC Facilities: Our Cell Processing Center meets Japan's rigorous certification requirements, ensuring optimal cell viability and sterility.
• Research-Backed Protocols: Treatment protocols are informed by ongoing research from institutions like the University of Tokyo, ensuring evidence-based care.
• Advanced Technology: Japanese facilities utilize cutting-edge MSC culture and processing technology that maximizes therapeutic potential.
• Medical Tourism Excellence: Tokyo's Azabudai Hills district represents Japan's premier medical hub, combining world-class facilities with international accessibility.
At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, we combine these national advantages with transparent pricing and comprehensive care to deliver exceptional value in regenerative medicine.

faq.answer: Costs vary based on treatment complexity and facility standards. At Rakan Clinic Tokyo, pricing includes comprehensive care: consultation, fat collection, CPC processing, injection procedure, and follow-up. We provide transparent pricing during your consultation.

faq.answer: Stem cell therapy is typically not covered by standard health insurance in most countries, including Japan, as it's often considered an elective regenerative medicine procedure. However, we can provide documentation for health savings accounts or tax purposes.

faq.answer: Costs reflect the sophisticated CPC processing, strict quality control protocols, certified facility requirements, and comprehensive care. Quality and safety standards in Japan's PMDA-regulated facilities justify the investment in your health.

faq.answer: We offer different treatment plans to accommodate various needs and budgets. During your consultation, we'll discuss payment options and can provide flexible arrangements for qualified patients.

faq.answer: Results typically remain for 12–36 months. Booster infusions and supportive rehabilitation help extend the value of your investment.

faq.answer: Fat collection may cause mild soreness for a short period. Infusions themselves are comfortable and performed in a private treatment suite.

stem-cell-therapy-japan-safety.title: Why Japan Is Becoming a Leader in Stem Cell Therapy
stem-cell-therapy-japan-safety.excerpt: Understand how Japan's Act on Regenerative Medicine, MHLW oversight, and CPC certification deliver exceptionally safe stem cell therapy in Tokyo.
stem-cell-therapy-japan-safety.keywords: stem cell therapy Japan, safe stem cells Tokyo, MHLW regenerative medicine, CPC certified Japan, PMDA class II regenerative medicine
stem-cell-therapy-japan-safety.quickAnswer: Japan’s stem cell therapy ecosystem is tightly regulated by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare. Certified Class II providers and licensed CPC facilities ensure high stem cell safety, viability, and treatment consistency for every patient.
content: Japan has spent more than a decade building one of the safest environments in the world for regenerative medicine. Every treatment plan at Rakan Clinic Tokyo is filed under the Act on Regenerative Medicine (ARM) and reviewed by the Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (PMDA).
Regulation Under the Act on Regenerative Medicine

Autologous mesenchymal stem cell infusions fall under Class II of the ARM. Providers must submit detailed protocols describing cell sourcing, culture methods, dosing, and post-treatment monitoring. Approval is granted only after external ethical review and Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare confirmation.
Class II Regenerative Medicine Plan Certification

Our clinic renews its Class II plan annually, submitting data on patient outcomes, adverse event surveillance, and protocol refinements. This mandatory reporting keeps therapies transparent and accountable.
CPC/CPF Facility Requirement and Inspections

Stem cells must be processed inside a licensed Cell Processing Center (CPC) or Cell Processing Facility (CPF). Inspectors audit sterility logs, air-quality reports, and chain-of-custody documentation. Rakan Clinic operates an in-house CPC inside Azabudai Hills, ensuring cells never leave our controlled environment.
Autologous Stem Cell Safety Advantages

Japan prioritises autologous (self-derived) cells, which eliminates donor rejection risk and aligns with PMDA guidance on personalised medicine. Culturing with the patient’s own plasma preserves compatibility and reduces allergens.
Why International Patients Choose Japan

Patients value the combination of rigorous oversight, partnerships with universities such as the University of Tokyo, and discreet hospitality within Azabudai Hills. For related insights, read “Understanding Stem Cell Therapy Cost” and “Stem Cell Therapy Recovery Time.”
Schedule a consultation for CPC-certified stem cell therapy in Tokyo to review your eligibility, personalised timeline, and travel logistics.

faq.question: How is stem cell therapy regulated in Japan?
faq.answer: The Act on Regenerative Medicine and PMDA oversight require clinics to submit Class I–III plans, undergo independent ethical review, and report outcomes to the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare.

faq.question: What is a Class II regenerative medicine plan?
faq.answer: Class II covers autologous stem cell therapies. Clinics must document safety protocols, physician credentials, and follow-up schedules before approval.

faq.question: How long do stem cell therapy results last?
faq.answer: Most patients maintain benefits for 12–36 months, particularly when following booster schedules and rehabilitation guidance.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: Fat collection may cause mild soreness for a day or two, while the infusion itself is typically painless.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We generally start with one session and recommend boosters every four months, adjusted to your diagnosis and response.

stem-cell-therapy-results-timeline.title: Stem Cell Therapy Results by Month: What to Expect
stem-cell-therapy-results-timeline.excerpt: Follow the recovery milestones after stem cell therapy—from the first week of reduced inflammation to the six-month regeneration peak and booster planning.
stem-cell-therapy-results-timeline.keywords: stem cell recovery timeline, results after stem cells, MSC regeneration timeline, stem cell booster schedule
stem-cell-therapy-results-timeline.quickAnswer: Most patients notice improvements within 4–6 weeks, see visible gains at 2–3 months, and realise full benefits around 6 months. Reinjection every four months helps maintain progress.
content: Tracking progress helps patients remain encouraged and proactive. While individual outcomes vary, stem cell recovery generally follows consistent phases.
Day 1–7: Reduced Inflammation
Immediately after infusion, MSCs release anti-inflammatory cytokines that calm irritated tissues. Many patients report less morning stiffness and greater comfort within the first week.
Month 1: Mobility and Pain Changes
By weeks four to six, patients typically notice smoother motion and fewer pain spikes during daily activities. Physical therapy becomes more productive at this stage.
Month 2–3: Tissue Regeneration Phase
MSCs differentiate and recruit native cells to rebuild cartilage, tendons, or nerve tissue. Imaging may show denser structures while strength and endurance improve.
Month 6: Maximum Visible Benefit
The six-month milestone usually reflects peak improvement. Pain scores continue downward, balance improves, and patients resume higher-level exercise under medical supervision.
Recommended Four-Month Booster Cycle
For chronic conditions we often recommend boosters every four months to refresh cytokine signalling. Review your plan with our physicians to personalise timing.
Lifestyle Integration
Success depends on adherence to physiotherapy, anti-inflammatory nutrition, and quality sleep. Explore the “Stem Cell Therapy Recovery Time” article for detailed rehabilitation guidance.
Learn whether you’re a good candidate by consulting our regenerative team and reviewing imaging, lab markers, and lifestyle goals together.

faq.question: When will I start to feel better?
faq.answer: Most patients begin to feel measurable relief between 4 and 6 weeks, though early anti-inflammatory changes can appear sooner.

faq.question: How long do stem cell therapy results last?
faq.answer: Benefits commonly last 12–36 months, especially when maintenance boosters and rehabilitative care are followed.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: The harvesting site may be tender for a day or two. Infusions themselves are typically painless and completed in a relaxing setting.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We usually begin with a single session and evaluate booster frequency every four months based on imaging and symptom progress.

anti-aging-stem-cell-therapy-tokyo.title: Stem Cells for Anti-Aging: Does It Really Work?
anti-aging-stem-cell-therapy-tokyo.excerpt: Explore how autologous MSC therapy may support longevity, immune balance, and hormonal stability for patients pursuing advanced anti-aging strategies in Tokyo.
anti-aging-stem-cell-therapy-tokyo.keywords: anti-aging stem cells, longevity regenerative medicine, hormone aging stem cells, Tokyo longevity clinic
anti-aging-stem-cell-therapy-tokyo.quickAnswer: Autologous stem cell therapy may help reduce systemic inflammation, enhance recovery, and support hormonal balance. Results vary according to baseline health and ongoing lifestyle habits.
content: Healthy longevity requires aligned immune, endocrine, and metabolic systems. Autologous MSC therapy supports each component by moderating inflammation and stimulating repair.
Why Aging Accelerates Inflammation
Inflammaging—the chronic low-grade inflammation associated with age—undermines cellular communication. MSC secretomes calm overactive immune responses and improve mitochondrial resilience.
MSC Immunomodulatory Benefits
Patients frequently report steadier energy, sharper mental clarity, and improved sleep quality when MSC therapy is paired with personalised nutrition and exercise programmes.
Support for Menopausal and Andropause Symptoms
Menopausal women and men experiencing andropause often benefit from MSC therapy combined with hormone optimisation. Reduced inflammation enhances endocrine responsiveness and muscle recovery.
Realistic Benefit Ranges
Stem cells are not a stand-alone anti-aging cure. Outcomes depend on genetics, stress management, and adherence to comprehensive longevity plans developed by our clinicians.
Ideal Candidates
We see strong responses in patients managing inflammation-driven fatigue, recovery plateaus, or hormone-related mood changes. Thorough assessments ensure readiness and safety.

Ask our doctors about anti-aging support so we can align stem cell infusions with hormone therapy, nutrition, and targeted exercise. Explore complementary articles such as “Stem Cell Therapy Results by Month” and “Stem Cell Therapy for Joint Pain.”

faq.question: Can stem cells reverse aging?
faq.answer: Stem cells support healthier aging by reducing inflammation and promoting repair. They do not stop chronological aging but can improve resilience when part of a medical longevity plan.

faq.question: How long do results last?
faq.answer: Longevity-focused patients often maintain benefits for 12–24 months. Booster infusions every 4–6 months help sustain improvements.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: The fat collection step may cause mild soreness for a few days; infusions are typically comfortable and performed in a lounge setting.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We usually recommend one foundational session followed by customised boosters based on laboratory markers, hormone levels, and lifestyle goals.

cpc-cell-processing-center-japan.title: What Is a CPC? Inside Japan’s Stem Cell Safety System
cpc-cell-processing-center-japan.excerpt: Take a guided look inside Japan’s certified Cell Processing Centers (CPCs) and learn how they keep stem cell therapies sterile, viable, and consistent.
cpc-cell-processing-center-japan.keywords: cell processing center, CPC medical Japan, safe stem cell lab Tokyo, CPC inspection standards
cpc-cell-processing-center-japan.quickAnswer: Japan requires stem cells to be processed in licensed CPC facilities that maintain sterility, viability, and controlled culture conditions. Rakan Clinic operates its own in-house CPC within Azabudai Hills.
content: A Cell Processing Center (CPC) is the nerve centre of any legitimate stem cell programme. Japan’s regulations demand CPC licensing, routine inspections, and traceable documentation for every batch of cells.
CPC = Cell Processing Center Explained
CPCs are clean-room laboratories with filtered air, pressure controls, and validated equipment. They follow Good Manufacturing Practice principles to guarantee purity and consistency.
In-House Culture Maintains Cell Freshness
By keeping our CPC on-site, we eliminate transport delays. Cells are collected, expanded, tested, and reinfused without leaving the building—protecting viability and reducing contamination risk.
Use of the Patient’s Own Blood for Safety
We supplement stem cell cultures with autologous serum instead of animal-derived media. This approach minimises allergy risks and aligns with PMDA guidance on personalised therapies.
Zero Transport Contamination Risk
• Cells move through protected corridors under monitored temperature and humidity.
• Release testing confirms sterility, endotoxin levels, and cell counts before infusion.
• Digital logs capture every touchpoint for complete traceability.
Tour our CPC digitally—request details to see how we protect your cells from collection to infusion and learn why Japan’s laboratory standards set the global benchmark.

faq.question: What happens inside a CPC?
faq.answer: Cells are isolated, expanded, washed, and tested within ISO-class clean rooms using validated protocols and constant environmental monitoring.

faq.question: How long do stem cell therapy results last?
faq.answer: High-quality CPC processing contributes to durable outcomes—typically 12–36 months—because viable cells engraft more effectively.

faq.question: Does CPC processing add discomfort?
faq.answer: No. CPC work happens behind the scenes. Patients relax in private suites while our laboratory team prepares the infusion.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We tailor session frequency to your diagnosis. Many patients repeat therapy every four months to maintain progress.

knee-osteoarthritis-stem-cells-tokyo.title: Can Stem Cells Help Knee Osteoarthritis?
knee-osteoarthritis-stem-cells-tokyo.excerpt: Review how autologous MSC therapy may reduce knee pain, support cartilage repair, and delay or avoid knee replacement surgery.
knee-osteoarthritis-stem-cells-tokyo.keywords: knee stem cell therapy, avoid knee replacement, cartilage regeneration, knee pain stem cells Tokyo
knee-osteoarthritis-stem-cells-tokyo.quickAnswer: Autologous MSC therapy may help reduce knee pain, support cartilage repair, and delay surgery for appropriate patients. Results vary based on degeneration severity and rehabilitation adherence.
content: Knee osteoarthritis affects millions worldwide and is a leading reason patients seek regenerative medicine. Stem cell therapy offers a middle path between conservative care and invasive surgery.
Why Cartilage Degeneration Causes Pain
Cartilage lacks direct blood supply, so once it is damaged, it heals slowly. Inflammation further erodes tissue and irritates surrounding nerves.
How MSCs Reduce Inflammation and Repair Tissue
Injected MSCs secrete growth factors that calm inflammation, stimulate chondrocytes, and enhance joint lubrication. Many patients see improvements in stability and strength.
When Stem Cells vs Surgery Makes Sense
Stem cells are ideal for mild-to-moderate degeneration, patients wishing to postpone surgery, or those recovering from arthroscopy. Advanced bone-on-bone cases may still require replacement.
Imaging and Candidate Evaluation
We review MRI, X-ray, and gait assessments to determine eligibility. We also consider weight, alignment, and previous injections.
Rehabilitation Synergy
We partner stem cell therapy with physiotherapy, strength training, and weight management, helping patients maintain long-term results.
Talk with our joint pain specialists to review imaging and map an evidence-based plan. Explore “Stem Cell Therapy Results by Month” for a step-by-step recovery timeline.

faq.question: Can stem cells replace knee surgery?
faq.answer: Stem cells can delay or reduce the need for surgery in many moderate cases. Severe deformities may still necessitate joint replacement.

faq.question: How long do results last for knee osteoarthritis?
faq.answer: Patients frequently experience 12–24 months of relief. Booster infusions and targeted therapy can prolong benefits.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: The harvesting site may be sore briefly. Knee injections are performed under local anaesthesia for comfort.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We usually begin with one session and reassess after 4–6 months. Additional boosters depend on imaging and symptom progress.

adipose-vs-bone-marrow-stem-cells.title: Which Type of Stem Cells Are Better? Adipose vs Bone Marrow vs Donor Cells
adipose-vs-bone-marrow-stem-cells.excerpt: Compare adipose-derived MSCs with bone marrow and donor sources to understand yield, safety, and clinical suitability for regenerative therapy.
adipose-vs-bone-marrow-stem-cells.keywords: adipose stem cell therapy, best stem cell source, MSC comparison, donor stem cells
adipose-vs-bone-marrow-stem-cells.quickAnswer: Adipose-derived stem cells provide high cell yield, minimal harvesting discomfort, and low aging impact—making them the preferred option for most regenerative programmes.
content: Choosing the right stem cell source directly influences treatment results. Adipose tissue, bone marrow, and donor cells all have roles—understanding their strengths guides personalised care.
MSC Abundance
Adipose tissue contains 100–1000 times more MSCs per millilitre than bone marrow. This high yield means smaller harvests produce ample cell numbers for therapy.
Aging Resilience
Adipose MSCs retain telomere length and differentiation capacity longer than bone marrow MSCs, particularly in patients over 50.
Convenience and Safety

Fat harvesting is outpatient and minimally invasive, whereas bone marrow aspiration can be more uncomfortable and yields fewer cells. Autologous adipose cells also eliminate donor matching and rejection risks.
Comparing Autologous vs Donor Cells
Donor (allogeneic) cells introduce immune considerations and stricter regulatory pathways. Japan’s Class II framework favours autologous adipose-derived MSCs for safety and consistency.
Learn how fat-derived cells work in practice by combining this guide with “What Is a CPC?” and “Stem Cell Therapy Results by Month,” then speak with our physicians about your eligibility.

faq.question: Why choose adipose-derived stem cells?
faq.answer: They provide higher yields, age more slowly, and require only a minimally invasive collection procedure.

faq.question: Do bone marrow stem cells work better?
faq.answer: Bone marrow cells can be effective, but yield and comfort often favour adipose cells for orthopedic and longevity goals.

faq.question: How long do adipose stem cell results last?
faq.answer: Patients typically maintain improvements for 12–36 months, especially with supportive rehabilitation and booster sessions.

faq.question: Does the harvest hurt?
faq.answer: Adipose harvesting uses local anaesthesia. Mild soreness usually resolves within a few days.

conditions-stem-cell-therapy.title: 15 Conditions Improved by Stem Cell Therapy
conditions-stem-cell-therapy.excerpt: Survey the orthopedic, immune, metabolic, and neurological conditions that may respond to autologous MSC therapy under Japan’s regulatory framework.
conditions-stem-cell-therapy.keywords: stem cell therapy uses, diseases stem cells treat, MSC indications, regenerative medicine conditions
conditions-stem-cell-therapy.quickAnswer: Clinical experience suggests MSCs may improve orthopedic, autoimmune, neurological, vascular, and metabolic disorders when patients are carefully selected and monitored.
content: Stem cell therapy is not a universal remedy, but when applied responsibly it offers meaningful improvements across multiple disease categories.
Orthopedic Applications
Knee, hip, and shoulder osteoarthritis respond well to MSC-driven cartilage repair and anti-inflammatory effects. Tendon and ligament injuries benefit from enhanced collagen production.
Immune and Inflammatory Disorders
Autoimmune conditions like rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and psoriasis may experience immune modulation with MSC therapy when traditional treatments plateau.
Metabolic and Vascular Conditions
Emerging data supports MSC use in type 2 diabetes, chronic kidney disease, and peripheral artery disease through improved microcirculation and anti-inflammatory effects.
Neurological Support

Stem cells are being evaluated for spinal cord injuries, neuropathy, Parkinson’s disease, and cognitive decline. While research continues, early reports show improved quality of life in selected patients.
How Our Team Determines Eligibility
We combine lab diagnostics, imaging, and specialist consultations to confirm suitability. If MSC therapy is not indicated, we recommend safer alternatives or adjunct therapies.
Book an evaluation for your condition to review available evidence, realistic outcomes, and a comprehensive care plan.

faq.question: Which conditions respond best to stem cell therapy?
faq.answer: Orthopedic and inflammatory disorders currently have the strongest supportive data, but we review each diagnosis individually.

faq.question: How long do results last?
faq.answer: Benefits often persist for 12–36 months when patients follow rehabilitation, nutrition, and booster schedules.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: Stem cell procedures are minimally invasive. Most patients experience mild soreness at the harvest site that resolves within days.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We personalise session frequency. Chronic immune or metabolic conditions may benefit from quarterly boosters, while orthopedic cases often reassess at six months.

stem-cell-therapy-exclusions.title: Who Should Not Receive Stem Cell Therapy?
stem-cell-therapy-exclusions.excerpt: Review medical exclusions, safety considerations, and the evaluation steps we follow before approving stem cell therapy.
stem-cell-therapy-exclusions.keywords: stem cell therapy risks, who can't get stem cells, stem cell exclusions, contraindications stem cell therapy
stem-cell-therapy-exclusions.quickAnswer: Exclusions include infectious diseases, active cancers, pregnancy, breastfeeding, uncontrolled chronic illnesses, and allergies to treatment-related substances.
content: Safety is our highest priority. We follow national and international guidelines to determine when patients should postpone or avoid stem cell therapy.
Full Exclusion List
Active infections, malignant cancers, pregnancy, breastfeeding, uncontrolled diabetes, severe heart failure, and allergies to anaesthetics or processing agents are primary contraindications.
Why These Risks Exist
Infections could spread during infusion, cancer cells may react unpredictably to growth factors, and pregnancy introduces unique immune and hormonal considerations.
Safety Evaluation Steps
Our team conducts laboratory screening, imaging, and multidisciplinary consultations—including oncology, cardiology, or obstetrics—to confirm eligibility before scheduling stem cell collection.
Ethical Commitment
If stem cell therapy is not indicated, we provide transparent guidance on safer alternatives and coordinate referrals when appropriate.
Check if you’re eligible safely by booking a consultation. We will review your medical history and collaborate with your physicians to build an evidence-based plan.

faq.question: Can cancer survivors receive stem cell therapy?
faq.answer: Many survivors can after oncologist clearance and an appropriate remission period. Active cancers remain a contraindication.

faq.question: Are infectious diseases an exclusion?
faq.answer: Yes. Active infections must be fully treated before we consider MSC therapy to avoid systemic complications.

faq.question: How long do stem cell therapy benefits last?
faq.answer: Eligible patients typically maintain improvements for 12–36 months with booster sessions and lifestyle support.

faq.question: Does the procedure hurt?
faq.answer: For eligible patients, procedures are minimally invasive. When exclusions apply, we discuss alternative pathways instead.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: Eligibility must be confirmed first. After approval, we usually begin with one session and customise booster frequency according to progress.

culture-supernatant-explained.title: What Is Culture Supernatant and Why Do Some Patients Choose It?
culture-supernatant-explained.excerpt: Understand how stem cell culture supernatant works, when to combine it with MSC infusions, and the safety benefits of using your own cell-derived serum.
culture-supernatant-explained.keywords: stem cell supernatant, regenerative serum therapy, exosome therapy Japan, culture media infusion
culture-supernatant-explained.quickAnswer: The culture fluid collected from your own stem cells contains fresh cytokines and growth factors that can be administered for faster symptom relief or between MSC boosters.
content: Culture supernatant is the nutrient-rich fluid collected during MSC expansion. It contains secreted cytokines, growth factors, and extracellular vesicles generated by your cells in our CPC.
Difference from Stem Cells
Supernatant does not include live stem cells, but it delivers the signalling molecules they produce. Many patients use it to support rapid relief while MSCs engraft and remodel tissue.
Why Freshness Matters
We process and administer supernatant immediately after culture to preserve active proteins. Freshness maximises potency and aligns with Japan’s quality standards.
When to Combine with MSC Infusion
Supernatant can be delivered on its own or scheduled between MSC boosters. Patients managing chronic inflammation often alternate the two for continuous support.
Safety: Self-Derived Product Advantage
Because the fluid originates from your own cells, it carries the same autologous safety profile as MSC therapy and complies with Class II regenerative medicine guidelines.
Ask about combination protocols and read “Stem Cell Therapy Results by Month” to time supernatant sessions alongside MSC boosters.

faq.question: Can I receive culture supernatant without stem cells?
faq.answer: Yes. Some patients start with supernatant for quick symptom relief, then schedule MSC infusions for long-term regeneration.

faq.question: How long do the effects last?
faq.answer: Supernatant provides short-term support, while MSC infusions deliver 12–36 months of benefit. Combining both can extend outcomes.

faq.question: Does the infusion hurt?
faq.answer: Supernatant infusions are comfortable and performed in a lounge setting with medical supervision.

faq.question: How many sessions will I need?
faq.answer: We often recommend supernatant every 4–6 weeks between MSC boosters, customised to symptom patterns and lab results.
